metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31215 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SchedMD Slurm before 20.02.7 and 20.03.x through 20.11.x before 20.11.7 allows remote code execution as SlurmUser because use of a PrologSlurmctld or EpilogSlurmctld script leads to environment mishandling.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31215` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 21.08.5
libpam-slurm-adopt - 21.08.5
libpmi0 - 21.08.5
libpmi2-0 - 21.08.5
libslurm-perl - 21.08.5
libslurm39 - 21.08.5
libslurmdb-perl - 21.08.5
slurm-client - 21.08.5
slurm-client-emulator - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-elasticsearch-plugin - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-emulator - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-hdf5-plugin - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-influxdb-plugin - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-ipmi-plugins - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-jwt-plugin - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-kafka-plugin - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-mysql-plugin - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-plugins - 21.08.5

slurmrestd - 21.08.5
sview - 21.08.5
No subscription required
